AI Description: Message Passing Interface (MPI) is a standardized and portable message-passing system designed to enable scalable, parallel computing on a wide variety of parallel computers. It is widely used in the field of high-performance computing (HPC) to develop parallel programs that can run efficiently on distributed memory architectures.
Core Features: Allows Communication & Data Exchange Between Parallel Processes, Supports Creation Of Parallel Applications For Distributed Memory Systems, Facilitates Coordination & Synchronization Of Parallel Tasks, Scalable & Efficient For Large-Scale Parallel Computing
